questionListItems.title:
As a successful CO applicant, what is the PSLE score required of me to
be "eligible to attend the Express course based on PSLE results"?

answer.body:
You will be eligible for entry to CHS by DSA so long as you obtain a PSLE score that allows you
to join the Express course.

questionListItems.title:
Does being in DSA X (e.g. MEP) potentially reduces my chances of attending other
talent programmes in CHS?

answer.body:
In CHS, we aim to develop students holistically so long as they have the passion for learning
and take the initiative to excel. Being a DSA student does not reduce your chance in being
selected for other development programmes. For example, some of our DSA Mathematics
students are also in our CŒ©ERGY science talent development programme.
All DSA students (including Sports DSA) have a range of opportunities to develop themselves,
be it in aesthetics, bilingualism, humanities or science. All DSA students are also able to develop
themselves and seize opportunities to be student leaders, be it in their respective CCAs, as
Ambassadors in another area, or as part of our Student Leadership Board (e.g. as Student
Councillor). DSA Academic, MEP and Leadership students can choose their CCAs after joining
CHS.

questionListItems.title: If my other talent(s) develop even better than my DSA talent over the course of my CHS school life, can I make a switch for talent development?

answer.body:
All DSA students are expected to stay with their DSA specialisation (e.g. MEP, Leadership) or
CCA for at least 4 years in CHS, subject to good performance and conduct. However, we do
assess individual DSA student‚Äôs progress at the end of Year 2 to help chart the students‚Äô
development.

questionListItems.title:
My family will not be in Singapore during the School Preference Indication phase.
What should I do?

answer.body:
You can submit your options online during the School Preference Indication phase. Your parents can in fact ask a proxy to help you submit the form if your family is not able to do so yourself, as long as the proxy is authorised. You can download the PROXY FORM from MOE website.


You may also enquire with your primary school General Office for any queries about this, as they would also have the form and details

questionListItems.title:
After I have accepted my Confirmed Offer, my family will not be in Singapore on the S1
Registration day. What should we do?

answer.body:
If your family is not able to make it on the S1 Registration day, you can fill in the MOE S1 Proxy
Form to appoint a suitable adult to register on the day itself.
You may also want to consider asking the proxy to assist with collecting materials and forms on
that day. Our bookstore and uniform sales will continue over the Dec holidays until around 30
Dec, and you should have time to purchase books, materials and uniform.
As we put our S1 Registration briefing materials online, you can refer to our web page for more
information upon returning to Singapore

questionListItems.title: Can my child not purchase the device?

answer.body:
Every student is required to have a device for teaching and learning purposes and is encouraged to purchase one through the school via MOE‚Äôs bulk tender. Students are encouraged to use the device model prescribed by the school, as the uniformity of systems and software would ensure a smooth learning experience for everyone. The device purchased through the school will come with the necessary warranty and insurance as well.


Students who do not wish to purchase a device because they already have their own devices still have to complete and submit Annex D: Intent to Purchase Personal Learning Device (PLD) form at go.gov.sg/pdlpadmin with relevant option selected. The school will then contact you on the assessment of suitability of the device for PDLP. Take note these existing devices must also be installed with a Device Management Application (DMA) software to provide a safe learning experience for the students.

questionListItems.title: Which model of personal learning device is CHS going to use?

answer.body: CHS is going to use the Lenovo 500e (3rd Gen) in 2023.

questionListItems.title: Why did Catholic High select a Lenovo Chromebook?

answer.body:
The teaching faculty has spent several months analysing the hardware requirements from

each subject discipline and has distilled to having the requirements of:

  • having a touchscreen with inking functionality and a stylus for students‚Äô annotations.

  • a sturdy keyboard for report and assignment typing.

  • a front-facing camera for zoom usage and a back-facing camera for taking a photo as a tablet.

  • portability for students to bring around.

  • having a long battery life to reduce the bulk of carrying an extra charger.

  • A ChromeOS for compatibility with the DMA.

  • SD card slot for provision of extra storage capacity.


The school has compared the hardware requirements of all the devices by MOE bulk tender and found that the Lenovo 500e meets all the specifications required for Catholic High teaching and learning. In addition, it is within the affordability of all families, has a low replacement cost and has a service centre in proximity to Catholic High School, i.e. Tai Seng service centre. This facilitates after-sale service after school hours, during holidays and when our students graduate from Catholic High.

questionListItems.title: Can parents purchase the device on their own?

answer.body:
No. The purchase of PLDs, and peripheral accessories, e.g. headphones and screens, riding
on the MOE Device Bulk Tender has to be made through the school.

questionListItems.title:
Can parents/teachers tap on the MOE Device Bulk Tender and purchase an
additional device for the younger sibling in primary school or as a laptop for
home usage?

answer.body:
Devices purchased through the MOE Bulk Tender are intended for learning in school and not
for personal use. Each student is only allowed to purchase one device as the purchase is
tied to the student's individual edusave accounts.

questionListItems.title: Can students share one PLD with their siblings?

answer.body:
For a smooth learning experience, it is strongly encouraged that each student has his/her
own PLD as prescribed by the school. This is because different schools may use a specific
PLD for teaching and learning. In addition, the student will be required to use the PLD in
school daily and for their learning after school, hence it might not be feasible to share the
PLD with their siblings.

questionListItems.title:
Do all students in a school have to use the same PLD? What about students who
opt out of using the school-selected device and wish to use their own? How will
this affect their learning?

answer.body:
Parents are strongly encouraged to buy the school prescribed chromebook for a seamless
teaching and learning experience in the classroom. With multiple operating systems (posed
by the various devices) in the classroom, it will be challenging for one teacher in a class to
provide assistance to the device software that may differ in interface from the rest of the
students, should assistance be required. Such extra time expended (which increased with
increasing number of OSs) will inevitably slow down the teaching and learning pace in the
classroom.

questionListItems.title:
What happens to the device after my child graduates after Level 4? Do they get to
keep the PLD for future tertiary education?

answer.body:
The school will uninstall the DMA from the devices upon students‚Äô graduation, and students
will have full control and personal ownership over their devices afterwards. If the student‚Äôs
device needs to be installed with DMA in JC/MI, it can be reinstated.

questionListItems.title: What softwares or applications are needed to be installed for students' PLDs?

answer.body:
The device will be installed with Microsoft 365 and Zoom.
Note that the parallel onboarding of Student ICONnect avails students a MOE suite of
Google apps such as Docs, Sheets, Slide, Form. Classroom, Calendar, Jamboard, Hangout,
Drive, Keep, etc., on the device.

questionListItems.title: How will Catholic High leverage the use of PLDs?

answer.body:
The Learning Vision espouses the goals that Catholic High would like all gentlemen to

embody.


In developing students' agency and digital literacies, online lessons on the organisation of

digital information on students' PLDs and note-taking will be taught in tandem with the

onboarding of notes onto the online platform of google classroom. This migration of hardcoy

to softcopy notes allows longer archival of school notes and reduces the weight of bags

students have to carry to school.


However, please be assured that assignments that require

pen and paper will continue to be given to them in hardcopies.

In augmenting teachers' teaching to activate students' learning, 20% of the Scheme of Work

will undergo technology infusion. In addition, these lessons will incorporate various

pedagogies of online group collaboration, simulation, augmented or virtual reality to make

abstract concepts concrete.


To mitigate the effect of extended screen use, our

Cyber-Innovation Ambassador will teach our gentlemen eye care exercises during

designated morning assembly periods.
